job_description: TRIUMFCanada's National Laboratory for Particle and Nuclear Physics STUDENT JOB PROGRAM Summer 2015 job posting Job number TR15-2-17Student job title:     ATLAS Software and Distributed ComputingName of project:     Software Performance and Distributed Computing ToolsOverview:     The ATLAS experiment at the Large Hadron Collider LHC) is studying     proton-proton, proton-lead and lead-lead collisions at very high     energy. The unprecedented energy densities created are allowing us to     study the structure of matter at a much smaller scale than was     previously possible, to extend investigations of the fundamental     forces of Nature, to understand the origin of matter and to search for     physics beyond the Standard Model (SM) of particle physics such as     supersymmetry, quark substructure, and extra dimensions, to name a     few. The experiment is collecting several Petabytes of raw data each     year during LHC operations, and is producing several derived and     simulated datasets that are of similar scale. The enormous amount of     data generated by ATLAS is distributed and analyzed onto the Worldwide     LHC Computing Grid infrastructure. The software and distributed     computing platforms used by ATLAS are critical to its scientific     success.         More information about ATLAS can be found at http://atlas.ch/ and     http://www.atlas-canada.ca                                                                                                                                                                           Duties:     The student will become familiar with the ATLAS research program and     its software and distributed computing environments that are used to     perform simulations and data analysis at the global scale. Develop     tools to integrate a cloud computing platform into ATLAS distributed     computing, including VM images optimization and performance testing     (I/O and cpu); optimize the interface between the ATLAS distributed     computing production system (used for simulation and analysis) and     local resource management system (including testing of new LRMS     solutions); data mining of ATLAS production and analysis jobs executed     on Canadian resources and performance assessment.Skills learned during this work experience:     The student will be introduced to the ATLAS software environment and     distributed computing platforms and tools (Grid and Cloud computing)     and its applications to perform intensive computational tasks and to     store and access large amounts of data which is distributed all around     the world.
job_requirements: Qualifications:     Ideally the student will have completed its second or third year in     physics or computer science field or equivalent. Good computing and     programming skills (C++ and/or Python) with experience and ease     working under a UNIX environment (e.g. Linux) are also an asset.Shiftwork required: NoPeriod of Work: May - Aug 2015Open To All Majors:No
